intro: Heteropterys coleoptera f. macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited starfruit, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped fruits that are typically yellow or orange when mature. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. The fruit is edible, though its texture and flavor can vary depending on the ripeness and variety.
